summary: The Protect Our Clothes from PFAS Act (H.R. 960) aims to modify the requirements for a garment to be considered water-resistant under the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. Introduced on February 4, 2025, by Ms. Pingree and Mr. Moore of Utah, the bill focuses on amending chapter 62, specifically deleting a sentence related to the water resistance definition. The bill falls under consumer protection and possibly environmental concerns related to PFAS chemicals.
